content: How can I help you today?

I've been struggling to sleep lately because I have so much on my mind. Work has been stressful, and I'm constantly worried about losing my job and not being able to provide for my family. It feels like I can't shut my brain off, and I end up scrolling through my phone, which I know isn't helping, but I don't know what else to do.

That sounds really overwhelming, having work stress and the worry about providing for your family weigh so heavily on your mind. It's understandable that it makes sleeping difficult when it feels like your thoughts won’t give you a break. Scrolling through your phone might help distract you in the moment, but it sounds like you're aware it might not be the best solution long-term. What do you think might help you feel more at ease or manage these thoughts differently?

I'm not sure, to be honest. I feel stuck in this cycle where I can't stop thinking about everything that's going wrong or could go wrong. I don't even know where to start when it comes to managing these worries or falling asleep easier. It just feels like too much sometimes.

That sounds like a tough spot to be in, feeling stuck in a cycle that feels overwhelming and hard to break. It's hard to know where to start when the worries are piling up like that. The fact that you're recognizing this pattern and talking about it is already a step forward. What would feeling less stuck or more calm look like to you, even if just a little bit?

Honestly, I’m not even sure what calm feels like right now. Maybe it would mean not lying in bed and overthinking for hours, or being able to actually focus on positive things instead of everything that could go wrong. But it feels so far away from where I am right now. I just feel really lost.

It sounds like calm feels distant right now, and being lost in your thoughts and worries makes it even harder to picture. You’ve mentioned wanting to focus on more positive things—something that feels far away, but also something important to you. That shows you’re thinking about what could be better. Even small steps can make a difference. What would that first step look like, if you could imagine one?

Maybe just finding a way to turn off my brain, even for a little bit. Like doing something before bed that doesn't make my thoughts worse, but I honestly don’t know what that would be. It feels like every time I try to relax, those worries just come back stronger.

It’s understandable that trying to relax feels like a struggle when the worries keep rushing back. Turning off your brain, even briefly, sounds like it could bring some relief, but finding something that truly helps might take a bit of exploring. It's okay not to have all the answers right now. Is there anything you’ve done before—maybe activities or routines—that helped settle your thoughts, even for a while?

One thing that’s helped me slightly in the past is listening to a podcast or music—something calm or engaging but not too overwhelming. It kind of distracts me without adding to the stress. But even then, it’s not perfect, and those worries sneak back in a lot of the time.

It's great that you've noticed podcasts or music can help you feel a bit calmer or distracted, even if only for a moment. Finding something that gives you a little break, even imperfectly, is a meaningful step. You’re showing awareness of what works for you, and that’s really important. It sounds like those worries still take over sometimes—what do you think would make it easier to keep them from sneaking back in?

I'm not really sure, to be honest. I guess maybe if I could shift my focus to something more calming or productive? But when I'm in the middle of it, it feels almost impossible to control where my mind goes, and it just spirals back to work and everything I'm stressed about.

It’s hard to shift focus when those spiraling thoughts feel so consuming, especially in the middle of stressful moments. Finding calming or productive ways to direct your energy sounds like something you value, even if it feels out of reach right now. You’ve already shown that you're willing to explore what might work for you. What would help you feel less overwhelmed or more in control of your focus, even in small ways?
Sorry, I think I’ve said all I can for now. Thank you for taking the time to listen and talk this through with me—it means a lot.
